author: Erich Schwartzel
title: At the Oscars, Prepare for Politics - WSJ
text:
The Oscars At the Oscars, Prepare for Politics From ‘La La Land’ to ‘Zootopia,’ producers are striving to position their films as political protests; ‘Lion’ as a statement on immigration? Winners at the 2017 Academy Awards on Sunday are expected to use their turn at the podium to make stump speeches. Here’s how political commentary is already impacting this year’s ceremony. Illustration: Ellen Surrey By Erich Schwartzel and Ben Fritz Feb. 23, 2017 11:13 a.m. ET 
Los Angeles 
Sunday’s Academy Awards ceremony is shaping up to be the world’s best-dressed Donald Trump protest. 
With few surprises expected in the evening’s major categories, the major question looming over Sunday’s telecast is just how outspoken Hollywood’s largely liberal A-list will be on their biggest global stage. If speeches at... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
